Docs.summary: Holds the security evidence for an application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ApplicationSecurityInfo provides security information about a manifest-activated application using information obtained from the application's manifests and its <xref:System.ActivationContext>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ActivationContext activationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: An <see cref="T:System.ActivationContext"> object that uniquely identifies the target application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo"> class using the provided activation context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ActivationContext> object contains an <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity> object that uniquely identifies an application by its full name and location.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the evidence for the application.
Docs.value: An <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.Evidence"> object for the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Evidence is the set of information that constitutes input for security policy decisions, such as deciding which permissions can be granted to code.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the application identity information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An application identity consists of the publisher's public key, the application name, the target processor architecture, the application culture, and the application version.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default permission set.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:System.Security.PermissionSet"> object representing the default permissions for the application. The default is a <see cref="T:System.Security.PermissionSet"> with a permission state of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the property has not been set, the get accessor returns a <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet> with a permission state of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the top element in the application, which is described in the deployment identity.
Docs.value: An <see cref="T:System.ApplicationId"> object describing the top element of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A deployment identity consists of the publisher's public key, the application name, the target processor architecture, the application culture, and the application version.
